data.title: Correction to Netflix Approves 10-for-1 Stock Split Article
data.description:
Netflix shares are up about 45% over the past year. "Netflix Approves 10-for-1 Stock Split" at 4:39 p.m. ET incorrectly said that shares are down about 45% over the past year.


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-30-25 2002ET

Air India seeks $1.14 billion lifeline from SIA and Tata, Bloomberg News reports
data.description:

Reuters could not immediately verify the report.

($1 = 87.8950 Indian rupees)

(Reporting by Chandni Shah in Bengaluru; Editing by Rashmi Aich)

data.title: Crypto exchange Coinbase beats Street estimates as trading volumes surge
data.description:
(Reuters) -Coinbase Global beat analysts' estimates for third-quarter profit on Thursday, as heightened volatility in digital assets boosted trading volumes at the cryptocurrency exchange, sending its shares up more than 3% after the bell.

Digital assets rallied in July as crypto-friendly policies by U.S. President Donald Trump attracted institutional investor interest, catapulting bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, to new peaks.

However, weak economic data in the following month sparked recession fears, triggering a sector-wide selloff as investors moved to liquidate riskier assets. Cryptocurrency exchanges often benefit from volatility in the sector as they earn more through transactions with investors seeking to hedge their portfolios.

Coinbase's transaction revenue rose to $1.05 billion during the quarter, from $572.5 million a year ago.

The company reported a net income of $432.6 million, or $1.50 per share, for the three months ended September 30, compared with $75.5 million, or 28 cents per share, a year earlier.

Analysts were expecting a profit of $1.06 per share, according to data compiled by LSEG.

Coinbase also closed its Deribit acquisition in the third quarter, bolstering its position in the derivatives market, an area where, according to Third Bridge analysts, it has historically lagged.

"Deribit is already the market leader in options. They had over 75% market share for options. Notably, this is all non U.S., and so there's paths to grow the market for options in the U.S.," finance chief Alesia Haas said on a conference call.

STABLECOIN - PART OF GROWTH STORY

Revenue from Coinbase's subscription and services unit, which includes businesses outside of trading, rose 34.3% to $746.7 million during the third quarter.

A portion of Coinbase's subscription and services revenue is derived from stablecoin holdings and related platform activities. Stablecoin revenue came in at $354.7 million, up from $246.9 million a year earlier.

"We are accelerating payments through stablecoin adoption, which we anticipate will continue given policy tailwinds, and ongoing adoption from financial institutions and corporates for payment and treasury needs," Coinbase said in a letter to shareholders.

Stablecoin has received optimism from traditional circles of finance and been at the forefront of legislation, with the GENIUS Act passed earlier in the year. The act aims to create a regulatory framework for stablecoins and promote broader adoption.

"Coinbase is cash-rich and growth-ready," said David Bartosiak, Stock Strategist at Zacks Investment Research.

"The company isn't just trading coins anymore, it's building the backbone of the new financial internet."

(Reporting by Pritam Biswas in Bengaluru; Editing by Shilpi Majumdar)

By Pritam Biswas

data.title: Utilities Down Amid Mixed Earnings -- Utilities Roundup

data.title: Roblox Sees Big Gain in Users, Driving up Costs
data.description:
Roblox (RBLX) reported a consolidated net loss of $257.4 million in the latest quarter fueled by user growth from hit games. David Baszucki, Roblox CEO, discusses the company's third quarter earnings with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech."

Bloomberg videos, provided by MT Newswires

data.title: Atlassian forecasts second-quarter revenue above estimates on AI demand boost
data.description:
(Reuters) -Atlassian forecast second-quarter revenue above estimates on Thursday, betting on strong demand for its enterprise software services as businesses upgrade to integrate artificial intelligence, sending its shares up nearly 7% in extended trading.

Businesses rushing to adopt AI are increasingly leveling up their systems to incorporate the data-intensive tech, helping drive demand for Atlassian's enterprise software services.

Atlassian expects revenue of between $1.535 billion and $1.54 billion in the second quarter, compared with analysts' average estimate of $1.51 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

Atlassian also announced that its finance chief Joe Binz will retire, effective June 30, 2026, and the company has commenced a search for its next CFO.

The company has been looking to improve cross-selling across its portfolio of products and is working to drive demand through its own AI products such as its Rovo Dev coding agent.

Atlassian's collaboration tools - such as Jira software for planning and project management and Confluence for content creation -- serve over 300,000 customers.

It expects cloud revenue to grow about 22.5% in the second quarter.

However, Atlassian's revenue stood at $1.37 billion for the three months ended September 30, compared with analysts' average estimate of $1.40 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG. 

Its first-quarter adjusted profit stood at $1.04 per share, compared with the estimates of 84 cents.

(Reporting by Arsheeya Bajwa; Editing by Anil D'Silva)

data.title: Tech Down After Meta Earnings -- Tech Roundup
data.description:
Shares of technology companies fell as investors looked askance on Meta Platforms' free spending on artificial-intelligence capabilities. Shares of the Facebook owner fell about 10% and yields on its bonds jumped after the company said it was looking to raise at least $25 billion from a jumbo debt sale.

Microsoft shares slipped amid similar concerns about its spending on AI infrastructure.

Alphabet rose as investors were more impressed by the Google owner's realized gains on its AI investments, which helped generate growth for its cloud-computing unit.

"The latest set of tech results [is] positive for the structural growth of artificial intelligence, as all three companies flagged a substantial increase in capital expenditures amid broad based demand for AI and its infrastructure," said strategists at money manager UBS Global Wealth Management.

Shares of travel-software maker Navan fell Thursday when it became the largest company to go public during the government shutdown.

Cloud-computing firm CoreWeave's plans to buy data-center operator Core Scientific in an all-stock transaction valued at about $9 billion flopped, rejected by Core Scientific's shareholders.

Roblox posted a wider third-quarter loss but boosted its revenue forecast for the year as a pair of videogaming crazes generated robust top-line growth.


Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-30-25 1844ET

data.title: 'Buy the Pull Back,' Says Jefferies' Thill
data.description:
Investors are pulling back from some tech stocks on news of big capital expenditures. But Brent Thill, equity research analyst at Jefferies, says companies must spend because demand is there and investors should buy the pullback. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech."

Bloomberg videos, provided by MT Newswires

data.title: First Solar beats expectations for third-quarter sales on robust demand
AIA Group's quarterly new business value hits record high on HK unit strength
data.description:
(Reuters) -Hong Kong-based insurer AIA Group said on Friday its value of new business (VONB) reached a record in the third quarter, boosted by growth in its flagship Hong Kong unit.

AIA's VONB, which gauges expected profit from new premiums and is a key barometer for growth, rose 25% to $1.48 billion, on a constant exchange currency basis, for the three months ended September 30. That compares with $1.16 billion a year ago.

Hong Kong, one of AIA's largest contributors in terms of profit, also logged an all-time high quarterly VONB.

"Our unrivalled distribution platform is a key competitive advantage and both our Premier Agency and partnership distribution channels generated very strong growth during the quarter," said Lee Yuan Siong, AIA's group CEO and president.

AIA said its proprietary Premier Agency model, the insurer's elite in-house sales force, generated more than 70% of the group's VONB, while recording 19% growth.

(Reporting by Shivangi Lahiri in Bengaluru; Editing by Alan Barona and Shilpi Majumdar)

data.title: Financials Up After Earnings -- Financials Roundup
data.description:
Shares of banks and other financial institutions ticked up after generally strong earnings in the sector.

Intercontinental Exchange's third-quarter earnings rose as reductions in operating expenses offset a drop in revenue.

Credit-card processor Mastercard reported higher third-quarter profit and sales, citing strong consumer and business spending.

Blue Owl shares fell after the private-credit investment firm logged a sharp decline in third-quarter earnings. Blue Owl co-chief Executive Marc Lipschultz said recent credit scares related to Tricolor and First Brands were "idiosyncratic" situations and not illustrative of market conditions.


Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-30-25 1834ET
